catalog.title: Independent Study
catalog.description: Involves a literature search and library work on a current topic in pharmacology or toxicology. Includes interdisciplinary projects, such as analyses of trends in drug use, toxicological projects, and applied clinical aspects.
catalog.subject: Pharmacology and Toxicology
catalog.long_title: Independent Study

notes.note:
PGY 300 OR 451 OR EQUIV

150 seats are reserved for students majoring in Nursing.

Exams will be held in-person on Mondays from 10:10AM - 11:25AM

catalog.title: Intro to Pharmacology
catalog.description: Introductory survey of the major drug groups commonly used in therapeutics. Presents the scientific bases of drug action and the utilization of their properties in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. Content and instruction is largely directed toward students in biomedical and life sciences programs Students are expected to have significant exposure to the basic sciences of chemistry, biology and biochemistry and must have completed a human physiology course at least equivalent to PGY 300. This class is online, therefore, to fully participate in both lecture and assessment activities there are certain computer software and hardware requirements.
catalog.subject: Pharmacology and Toxicology
catalog.long_title: Introduction to Pharmacology

notes.note: It is suggested that students who register for this course have taken General Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Cell Biology, Biochemistry and Physiology.

catalog.title: Experimental Pharmacology
catalog.description: PMY students only    Applies principles of pharmacology and toxicology in a lab course, which includes in vivo and in vitro techniques, including: assessing the duration of drug action in a rat model, preparing subcellular fractions of liver, quantifying total protein, cytochrome P450 (CYP) protein content and activity, CYP2B1/2 protein and mRNA, biochemical and morphological assessment of liver injury, training in the proper care and use of lab animals and radiation safety. The course will provide the students with basic laboratory techniques commonly utilized in research and experience with writing two detailed lab reports which follow the format used in scientific journals.
catalog.subject: Pharmacology and Toxicology
catalog.long_title: Experimental Pharmacology

catalog.title: Experimental Pharmacology
catalog.description: PMY students only    Applies principles of pharmacology and toxicology in a lab course, which includes in vivo and in vitro techniques, including: assessing the duration of drug action in a rat model, preparing subcellular fractions of liver, quantifying total protein, cytochrome P450 (CYP) protein content and activity, CYP2B1/2 protein and mRNA, biochemical and morphological assessment of liver injury, training in the proper care and use of lab animals and radiation safety. The course will provide the students with basic laboratory techniques commonly utilized in research and experience with writing two detailed lab reports which follow the format used in scientific journals.
catalog.subject: Pharmacology and Toxicology
catalog.long_title: Experimental Pharmacology

notes.note: This course will be held in DFN 04 with PMY 516.

catalog.title: Special Topics
catalog.description: This advanced level undergraduate course will provide an overview of special topics relating to the fields of pharmacology and neuroscience.  This course will allow instructors to introduce a variety of contemporary and cutting edge ideas to students.
catalog.subject: Pharmacology and Toxicology
catalog.long_title: Special Topics in Pharmacology/Neuroscience

notes.note:
PGY 300 and PGY 412 or
PGY 451 and PGY 452 are REQUIRED!!!

catalog.title: Essentials of Pharmacology II
catalog.description: Explores principles of drug action on biological systems, action mechanism of each agent class on specific organ systems, a review and extension of pertinent physiologic concepts of that system, chemical structure-drug activity relationships, sites of action, metabolic patterns of principal drugs, and therapeutic and toxicologic aspects.  Dual-listed with PMY 512.
catalog.subject: Pharmacology and Toxicology
catalog.long_title: Essentials of Pharmacology II

notes.note: THE FIRST RECITATION FOR PMY 406 ON FRIDAY, JANUARY 31ST WILL BE HELD IN DFN 203.  ALL OTHER FRIDAYS WILL BE IN 150 FARBER HALL.
